episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of-Evangeline-Young-MVA-8-12-2023. Client: Estate of Evangeline Young. The point of contact for this matter is Susie Tran, who can be reached at 502-345-3915; alternatively, Dwight Young can be contacted at cell 502-224-7146 or by email at Dwightlamaryoung@yahoo.com. The Estate represents Evangeline Young, the decedent, who resided at 8506 Gregory Way, Louisville, KY 40219. For the record, Evangeline’s date of birth is June 9, 1978, and her Social Security number is to be texted by Dwight when available.

Evangeline Young is the deceased. The date of death (DOA) is August 12, 2023, at 3:00 a.m. The incident occurred when an LMPD officer was speeding down Smyrna Rd without emergency lights on, and the plaintiff (PL) was attempting a left turn onto Michael Ray; the two vehicles struck head-on. Evangeline was transported by EMS to the University of Louisville (UofL) hospital and passed away the following evening. Injuries were fatal. It was reported that Evangeline was under the influence at the time, with indications that she was two to three times the legal limit. She had two grown children.
episodes.author: Justin Chumbley

episodes.natural_language:
This matter concerns the Estate of Evangeline Young in connection with a motor vehicle accident that occurred on August 12, 2023. The client is the Estate of Evangeline Young.

After reviewing the statute and case law, we do not believe there is any action against Derby City Gaming for overserving her, even if it contributed to the collision.

Under the Kentucky Revised Statutes (KRS), the individual who overserved is "primarily liable" and the proximate cause of any injuries. The legislative history makes pretty clear the intention of the dram shop act was to protect injured third-parties, not the individual being served. See KRS 413.241.
episodes.author: Bryce Koon

about.relevance: potential defendant discussed — determined unlikely to be actionable for overserving

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of-Evangeline-Young-MVA-8-12-2023. The client is the Estate of Evangeline Young. The matter concerns the Evangeline Young Police Report.

On September 27, 2023, two sequential emails were exchanged between Jessa Galosmo of Whaley Law Firm and Louisville/Jefferson County’s Risk Management Division regarding the police report for the motor vehicle accident involving Evangeline Young. Earlier that morning, at 9:45 AM, Jessa Galosmo sent an email to RiskMgmtDivision with the subject Evangeline Young Police Report. The message, cautioning that it originated from outside Louisville Metro, stated that the police report on the accident of their client, Evangeline Young, was attached. The email was signed by Jessa Galosmo of the Whaley Law Firm, including her contact information: Ph: (502) 357-9975 and Fax: (502) 364-9363, and a confidentiality notice restricting disclosure and requiring deletion if received in error.

Later that day, at 10:00:33 AM -0400, Jessa again emailed RiskMgmtDivision with the same subject and asked: “May I also know the fax number or email where I can send our letter of representation?”

Risk Management Division replied, indicating that there is already a claim set up for this incident and it is being handled by their adjuster. They provided the claim number: 305240079, and the contact information for Risk Management Services Co.: 502-326-5900. They stated they would also send the adjuster an email with Whaley’s contact information. The response was signed by Louisville Metro Government Risk Management Division, located at 611 W. Jefferson St., Louisville, Kentucky 40202, with Office: 502-574-3404 and Fax: 502-574-3932, and the general inbox Riskmgmtdivision@louisvilleky.gov. The signature included the standard confidentiality notice about privileged information and instructions if the message was received in error, and there was an image of the lou_metro_logo50px.

The initial 9:45 AM message from Jessa included a separate formal closing: “All the best, Jessa Galosmo, Whaley Law Firm,” followed by her direct line and fax (Ph: 502-357-9975; Fax: 502-364-9363). The email also carried the standard confidentiality disclaimer, noting that the information was confidential and intended solely for the recipient, and prohibiting disclosure or action by anyone not authorized to receive it.

In sum, the communications establish the Estate of Evangeline Young as the client, confirm that a police report for the Evangeline Young Police Report was attached in the initial submission, indicate that a representation letter is being prepared and needed (hence the question about where to send it), confirm that a claim already exists (Claim #305240079) and is under the care of the risk management adjuster, and provide the relevant contact details for Risk Management Services Co. and Louisville Metro Risk Management Division, along with the associated confidentiality notices and standard firm contact information for Whaley Law Firm.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of-Evangeline-Young-MVA-8-12-2023. Client: Estate of Evangeline Young. The matter concerns a motor vehicle accident involving Evangeline Young and is being managed under Louisville Metro’s claim system as Metro claim number 305240079.

On October 11, 2023, at approximately 11:33 AM, Clarke McCulloch, Property & Casualty Claims Manager, sent a message stating that he trusted Whaley Law Firm would forward their attached demand with supports to Ms. Young’s insurance carrier and/or estate manager. The message was addressed to Jessa Galosmo and was part of a forward chain showing the firm’s ongoing handling of the claim, with Jessa’s forward dated October 11, 2023 at 11:36:24 AM to Aaron Whaley and Bryce Koon, with Justin Chumbley CC’d.

The prior communications, beginning on September 27, 2023, reflect the core contact with Louisville Metro Government’s Risk Management Division about Evangeline Young’s police report. At 9:45 AM that day, Jessa sent RiskMgmtDivision an email entitled “Evangeline Young Police Report,” stating, “Hi, Attached is the police report on the accident of our client, Evangeline Young,” and signing off with “All the best, Jessa Galosmo” from the Whaley Law Firm; the message included confidential information disclosures and repeated the firm’s contact details (Ph: 502-357-9975; Fax: 502-364-9363). The email was followed by multiple confirmations and cautions about external emails and confidentiality.

Earlier that same day, at 9:55 AM, RiskMgmtDivision replied that a claim had already been set up for this incident and was being handled by their adjuster, providing the claim number 305240079 and listing Risk Management Services Co. with the contact number 502-326-5900; the division also stated they would send the firm’s contact information to the adjuster, and provided the Louisville Metro Risk Management Division’s mailing address (611 W. Jefferson St., Louisville, KY 40202), office phone (502-574-3404), fax (502-574-3932), and email (Riskmgmtdivision@louisvilleky.gov), along with a confidentiality notice.

At 10:01 AM on September 27, 2023, Jessa sent another email to RiskMgmtDivision, with EvangelineYoungMVAZ3900418@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com CC’d, asking, “May I also know the fax number or email where I can send our letter of representation?” The prior message had indicated there was already a claim and provided the claim number and contact information for Risk Management Services Co., with the expectation that an LOR would be forwarded to the adjuster.

A few minutes later, at 10:54 AM, RiskMgmtDivision replied that the LOR could be sent to the same email address and that they would forward it to the adjuster, again listing the same claim number (305240079) and the same Risk Management contact details. The reply included the standard confidentiality notice.

Filling in the thread, at 11:10 AM on September 27, 2023, Jessa sent a follow-up that the message regarding Evangeline Young Police Report should include “Please see attached LOR,” reflecting the continued exchange about the letter of representation and the police report. The CC line for this message included EvangelineYoungMVAZ3900418@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com, reinforcing the involvement of the estate’s representation.

In summary, the estate’s MVA matter has run through a series of communications beginning with the police report attachment on September 27, 2023, the solicitation and forwarding of a letter of representation, and subsequent coordination between Whaley Law Firm and Louisville Metro Risk Management, culminating in Clarke McCulloch’s October 11, 2023 directive to forward the attached demand with supports to the estate’s insurer or estate manager, with the Metro claim number 305240079 consistently referenced throughout. The chain includes the attached LOR and police report, the contact details for Risk Management Division and Risk Management Services Co., and multiple confidentiality and outside-email cautions that accompanied the emails.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of-Evangeline-Young-MVA-8-12-2023. Client: Estate of Evangeline Young.

In October 2023, within the matter titled Estate of Evangeline Young arising from the motor vehicle accident on August 12, 2023, attorney Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm initiated contact with Louisville Metro Police Department, corresponding with Scott Gowen. On October 11, 2023 at 12:36:10 PM (Eastern Time), Whaley advised Gowen that the family wished to retrieve items from Evangeline Young’s vehicle. He noted that the estate had not yet been opened, and that at present it would be the husband who was requesting access, though he might decide not to serve as administrator; that decision had not yet been made.

Earlier that same day, Gowen had written back with clarifying questions. He asked whether the family was seeking the release of the car itself or simply the retrieval of items from inside the vehicle, and whether there was a duly appointed personal representative of the Estate who was requesting the vehicle and its contents. Gowen stated his goal was to ensure that Louisville Metro Police Department (LMPD) released the vehicle to the correct person, assuming the investigation would be completed.

Prior to Gowen’s reply, Whaley had sent an initial message at 12:09 PM on October 11, 2023, in which he asked who he needed to speak with to gain access to Mrs. Young’s vehicle and belongings, noting that the family would like to have them. In that email, Whaley included his signature with contact information and a confidentiality notice indicating that the message was confidential and intended only for the recipient and others authorized to receive it; it also warned that disclosure, copying, distribution, or action regarding the contents could be unlawful if the recipient was not authorized. The message also contained the standard external-mail caution about the email originating from outside Louisville Metro. Whaley’s contact details were listed as Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222, 502-583-4022.

Case: Estate-of-Evangeline-Young-MVA-8-12-2023
Client: Estate of Evangeline Young

This note summarizes a short series of email communications in October 2023 about proof of ownership for the estate of Evangeline Young, in connection with the motor vehicle accident case Estate-of-Evangeline-Young-MVA-8-12-2023. The subject line used in these exchanges was “Proof of ownership E.Young,” and the participants were members of the Whaley Law Firm: Justin Chumbley, Bryce Koon, and Jessa Galosmo.

The earliest message in the thread is from Susie Tran, sent on Tuesday, October 17, 2023 at 10:55 AM to justin@whaleylawfirm.com, with the subject “Proof of ownership E.Young.” In her message, Susie wrote, “Proof of ownership E.Young Testing. Will send the documents (car title) over after verification that Ihave to correct email. Sent from my iPhone.” The record shows a follow-up from Susie later that day at 7:42 AM on Wednesday, October 18, 2023, to Justin, again with the subject line “Re: Proof of ownership E.Young,” asking, “Will this work for the proof of ownership?” This message also carried the “Sent from my iPhone” signature.

On Wednesday, October 18, 2023, at 11:23 AM, Justin Chumbley replied to Susie with a brief message that began with “Thanks,” the body of which is not fully shown in the record, followed by Justin’s standard signature including the Whaley Law Firm contact information: Justin Chumbley, Whaley Law Firm, Ph: (502)583-4022, Fax: (502)364-9363.

Later that same day, at 10:35 AM, Justin sent to Bryce Koon a message with the subject “FW: Proof of ownership E.Young,” copying Jessa Galosmo, though the visible portion of that forwarded message contains no further quoted content in this note.

Finally, at 10:59:44 AM on Wednesday, October 18, 2023, Bryce Koon sent a reply to Justin with the subject “RE: Proof of ownership E.Young.” The header notes include Bryce’s address and the cc to Jessa Galosmo, and the body states simply “Sent to Scott Gowan. Thank you.” The exchange shows the thread being circulated among the firm’s attorneys, with the intention of providing or confirming the necessary proof of ownership (likely including the car title) for the Estate of Evangeline Young.

Case: Estate-of-Evangeline-Young-MVA-8-12-2023
Client: Estate of Evangeline Young

In the Estate-of-Evangeline-Young-MVA-8-12-2023 matter, counsel for the Estate of Evangeline Young pursued access to items from Evangeline Young’s vehicle in the wake of a motor vehicle accident. The communications span mid-October 2023 and center on obtaining proof of ownership and permission to retrieve or access belongings from the vehicle, which was reportedly on hold.

On October 16, 2023, W. Bryce Koon, Esq., of The Whaley Law Firm, wrote to Scott Gowen. In that outside-Louisville Metro email (noting a caution that the message originated outside Louisville Metro and advising caution with links and attachments), Bryce acknowledged a prior discussion between Gowen and Aaron about Ms. Young’s family wanting to retrieve items from the vehicle and stated his intent to follow up on the request, offering to retrieve the requested items himself if necessary. The message concluded with Bryce’s standard attorney-client confidentiality disclaimer.

The following day, October 17, 2023, Gowen responded to Bryce, informing him that Louisville Metro Police Department (LMPD) would not permit access to the vehicle without some proof of ownership. Gowen asked Bryce to obtain such proof.

On October 18, 2023, Bryce replied to Gowen with a short message reading “RE: Evangeline Young,” stating “Good morning Scott, Please see below.” This reply also carried a standard confidentiality disclaimer indicating the message's privileged nature and advising the recipient to contact The Whaley Law Firm if the message was received in error.

Finally, on October 23, 2023, Bryce sent a follow-up to Gowen. In that email, Bryce said, “Good afternoon Scott, I just wanted to follow up on this. From my review online, it appears the vehicle is still on hold. Any update would be greatly appreciated.” This message, like the others, included The Whaley Law Firm’s confidentiality disclaimer.

Across these exchanges, the key facts preserved include: the case name and date, the client (Estate of Evangeline Young), the estate’s objective to retrieve items from the vehicle, the need for ownership proof before vehicle access could be granted by LMPD, Bryce’s willingness to retrieve items if needed, and the vehicle’s ongoing hold status as of October 23, 2023. Each email also contained a standard confidentiality and privilege disclaimer, with the October 16 message additionally carrying a caution about outside email. The Whaley Law Firm’s contact details (Bryce Koon, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; phone 502-365-5043; fax 502-237-3207) appeared in the signatures.

episodes.natural_language:
This narrative covers the TeamCare subrogation matter for the Estate of Evangeline Young related to the August 12, 2023 motor vehicle accident. The client is the Estate of Evangeline Young, and our file number for this matter is 23-23403. The case involves Evangeline L. Howard and the TeamCare subrogation process under the Central States Health Fund framework.

On November 1, 2023, Jessa Galosmo of Whaley Law Firm sent an email to Taneesha Jackson (Leg) at Central States to provide the contact information for the claim adjuster at Risk Management Services Company (RMSC). The adjuster is J. Clarke Mcculloch, who can be reached at 502-708-3100 or cmcculloch@rmsc.com.

Earlier that same day, Taneesha Jackson replied requesting the phone number for the at-fault party, referred to as Risk Management. Jessa’s email to Taneesha included the adjuster contact details noted above, and the message was part of the ongoing subrogation communications between TeamCare and Whaley Law Firm.

This exchange followed a prior thread from October 25, 2023. In Jessa’s 3:45 PM message, she wrote a high-alert notice regarding external email safety and provided the information previously requested: the PIP claim with USAA Insurance Company, claim number 037621490-800, and the BI claim with Risk Management Services Company, claim number 305240079. She also attached a copy of the police report.

Earlier on October 25, 2023, at 4:39 PM, Taneesha Jackson had requested from Jessa the following information: Ms. Howard’s auto insurance information (company name and claim/policy number), the at-fault party’s auto insurance information (company name and claim/policy number), and a copy of the police report.

The communication chain also included standard TeamCare signatures and contact details for Taneesha Jackson, including TeamCare – A Central States Health Fund, 8647 W. Higgins Rd, Chicago, IL 60631; Office phone 847.720.3629; Fax 847.518.9718; and tjackson@centralstatesfunds.org. The emails carried attorney-privileged and confidential notices, with instructions to recipients if they were not the intended recipients, and several formal disclaimers reiterating that benefits interpretations are subject to plan documents and are not final determinations.

In summary, the key facts documented are the estate’s MVA case, the file number 23-23403, the involvement of Evangeline L. Howard, the TeamCare subrogation context, the PIP and BI claim numbers (USAA 037621490-800 and RMSC 305240079, respectively), the attached police report, and the contact details of the RMSC adjuster, J. Clarke Mcculloch, as well as the at-fault party information being pursued through Risk Management.

Re: Evangeline Young

From: Aaron Whaley [agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com]
To: EvangelineYoungMVAZ3900418@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com, Gowen, Scott [Scott.Gowen@louisvilleky.gov]
Date: November 2, 2023, 10:46 AM Eastern Time

In a November 2, 2023 email, Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm told Scott Gowen that an open records request had been made for the body cam and dash cam footage of Officer Ray. Whaley stated that the dash cam would obviously shed a lot of light on the matter and could hasten resolution, and he requested that Gowen share the footage or provide any available timeframe for when it might be released.

To set the context, in a prior chain dated October 11, 2023, Whaley had written at 12:36 PM that the family wished to retrieve items from the vehicle and noted that the estate had not yet been opened. He indicated that, at that time, the request would be made by the husband, although the husband might decide not to serve as administrator, a decision that had not yet been made.

Earlier on October 11, 2023, at 12:19 PM, Gowen responded with clarifying questions: whether the family was seeking the car to be released to them or merely items from within the vehicle; and whether there was a duly appointed personal representative of the Estate requesting the vehicle and its contents. Gowen emphasized the need to ensure that Louisville Metro Police Department (LMPD) releases the vehicle to the correct person, assuming the investigation is complete.

Before that, at 12:09 PM on October 11, 2023, Aaron Whaley had written to Gowen (with EvangelineYoungMVAZ3900418_CC’d) stating that he was trying to determine who he needed to speak to in order to gain access to Mrs. Young’s vehicle and Mrs. Young’s belongings, as her family would like to have them. The message included Whaley’s firm details:

Whaley Law Firm
712 Lyndon Lane
Louisville, KY 40222
502-583-4022

The email also contained the standard confidentiality disclaimer indicating that the information was intended for the recipient and may be confidential, and cautioned that the email originated from outside Louisville Metro, advising not to click links or disclose information unless the sender’s address and content were known to be safe. The same contact details for Aaron Whaley appeared in the closing signature.

episodes.natural_language:
This case concerns the Estate of Evangeline Young in connection with a motor vehicle accident (MVA), filed as Estate-of-Evangeline-Young-MVA-8-12-2023. The following series of emails between attorney Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm and Louisville Metro Police Department liaison Scott Gowen trace the requests to access the vehicle and its contents and to obtain any dash or body camera footage from Officer Ray.

On October 11, 2023, Aaron Whaley asked Scott Gowen who he needed to speak with to obtain access to Mrs. Young’s vehicle and Mrs. Young’s belongings, noting that the estate had not yet been opened and that the husband would be the requester for now, though he may decide not to serve as administrator, a decision that had not yet been made.

Later that day, Gowen asked for clarification: was the family seeking release of the car or retrieval of items, and who would be the duly appointed personal representative to request the vehicle and its contents, ensuring that the vehicle is released to the right person once the investigation is complete?

Earlier that same day, Aaron had written to Gowen seeking guidance on who to contact to gain access to the vehicle and belongings, reiterating the family’s interest in obtaining them.

In another October 11, 2023 message, Aaron stated that the family wanted to retrieve items from the vehicle and that the estate had not yet been opened; for now, the husband would be the requester, but he might decide not to serve as administrator, a decision not yet made.

On November 2, 2023, Aaron wrote that they had made an open records request for Officer Ray’s body camera and dash camera. He explained that the dash camera would shed a lot of light on the case and could hasten resolution, and asked Gowen to share the footage or provide a timeframe if it could not be shared.

On November 6, 2023, at about 8:26 a.m., Gowen responded that Officer Ray’s body camera was not activated at the time of the accident because he was not on an emergency run, and there was no body camera that captured the accident. Based on Gowen’s investigation, he stated that Evangeline Young’s client was northbound on Smyrna Parkway and crossed into the southbound lane, striking Officer Ray, and he added that your client’s blood alcohol level was .22.

Later that same day, at approximately 11:36 a.m., Whaley replied: he assumed there was no dash cam either, in addition to no body camera. He then requested the officer’s vehicle “black box” data and asked Gowen to share it if it had already been retrieved; if not, he asked to schedule a time to obtain it, and he emphasized that the vehicle should not be disposed of.

episodes.original_body:
Case: Estate-of-Evangeline-Young-MVA-8-12-2023
Client: Estate of Evangeline Young

__CLIENT CONTACT__
__Details:__ Spoke with Mother (Updated Contact Cards) - Advised Probate Packet is ready for her signatures - Advised if she is able to bring Dwight, Jalen and/or James that would be great but not required - She advised that she will come in tomorrow to execute documents - She stated that Dwight maybe out of town still due to the holidays but she will check - Advised if any of them are not available to bring their email address & we can send to them to sign Waiver Electronically 
__Person Making Contact:__ Sarena
__Date & Time__: December 28 2023
episodes.natural_language:
Initial client contact on December 28, 2023, with the Mother of the Estate of Evangeline Young regarding probate matters. The call involved updating the contact cards, and Sarena spoke with the Mother about the case and the current steps.

Details discussed included that the Probate Packet is ready for the Mother’s signatures. It would be great if she could bring Dwight, Jalen, and/or James, but this is not required. The Mother advised that she will come in tomorrow to execute the documents. She stated that Dwight may still be out of town due to the holidays, but she will check. If any of them are unavailable, we should obtain their email addresses so we can send the Waiver Electronically for signing.

On January 26, 2024, the Jefferson Circuit Court accepted a filing in the matter captioned ESTATE OF: YOUNG, EVANGELINE LEE, in Case No. 24-P-000354, envelope number 7230545. This filing was listed under NCP (for eFiler) as Jefferson Circuit 24-P-000354, ESTATE OF: YOUNG, EVANGELINE LEE. The notification originated from noreply@kycourts.net and was electronically mailed on January 26, 2024 at 16:16:54 -0500 to agwhaley@WhaleyLawFirm.com, Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, and Bryce@WhaleyLawFirm.com.

The clerk’s note to the filer stated that, per Kentucky Revised Statutes 395.140(2), the bond form must be signed in front of the Probate clerk and that pre-signed bond forms are no longer accepted. The circuit clerk processed and accepted the following filing on January 26, 2024 at 4:15 PM Eastern.

The eFiler listed for this submission was Aaron Gregory Whaley, attorney for the plaintiff. The court handling the matter is the Jefferson Circuit Court (District). The case caption is ESTATE OF: YOUNG, EVANGELINE LEE, and the case number is 24-P-000354, with envelope number 7230545. A notice of this filing was electronically mailed to Whaley, Aaron Gregory at agwhaley@WhaleyLawFirm.com.

A scheduled event has been set: a Probate Hearing on March 4, 2024, at 1:00 PM Eastern, in the Jefferson Circuit County courtroom, with Hon. Jessica A. Moore presiding.

The following documents were included in this eFiling: Petition for Probate of Will / Appointment of Fiduciary; Certificate; Bond – Other.

Additional details can be viewed at https://kcoj.kycourts.net/efiling/Dashboard/Receipt?caseid=7230545, and the documents can be retrieved at https://kcoj.kycourts.net/eFilingRetrieval/Home/Package?id=F33DD276-1F1F-4854-85C1-A5215911A41C. Missed call logged on 2024-02-05 at 20:31:03.943000+00:00 for Aaron Whaley related to the Estate of Evangeline Young (Estate-of-Evangeline-Young-MVA-8-12-2023). Caller information shows Jefferson County District Court, phone 502-595-4434. A Filevine contact link is on record, and no caller email was provided.

The voicemail, left by Tish with the Jefferson County Probate Office, states: Hello, Mr. Aaron. I was calling, this is Tish with the Jefferson County Probate Office. I was calling to let you know that the filing of the file and annuity was sufficient. Judge King said it was sufficient and we deleted the date for that, but I do want to let you know that the bond was never signed for this guardianship. So we have just been holding on to the guardianship orders. So if Michael Johnson or you with the PA can sign that, then we can get you the guardianship orders. Again, this is t with the Jeff Scan probate office. Just give us a call or come down and we can get you these orders. You have a great day. Thank you for. The message includes some garbled wording, such as the line about the probate office and references to signing by Michael Johnson or the PA to obtain the guardianship orders.

From: Louisville Metro Government Public Records 
Date: Thu, Oct 12, 2023 at 3:49?PM
Subject: [Document Released to Requester] Louisville Metro Government
public records request #23-9522
To: 

-- Attach a non-image file and/or reply ABOVE THIS LINE with a message, and
it will be sent to staff on this request. --
Louisville Metro Government Public Records
Documents have been released for record request #23-9522 along with the
following message:

Please see the attached photographs provided by LMPD. Redactions have been
made to the name and address on a piece of mail belonging to an uninvolved
party, as well as a photograph of juveniles found in one of the vehicles,
all pursuant to KRS 61.878(1)(a).

Specific to your request for body and/or dash camera video I will send this
to LMPD Video Records to perform a search for video responsive to your
request. Pursuant to KRS 61.872(5) and due to the large volume of pending
video requests, at this time, the requested video is otherwise unavailable.
Please allow up to at least six months (March 20, 2024) to prepare and
provide any records we may possess. If they become available earlier, you
will be notified.

Case: Estate-of-Evangeline-Young-MVA-8-12-2023
Client: Estate of Evangeline Young

On October 12, 2023, Jessa Galosmo of Whaley Law Firm forwarded to the Estate of Evangeline Young an email containing the public records response for Louisville Metro Government public records request #23-9522. The forwarded message reflects that documents have been released for record request #23-9522 and include photographs provided by the Louisville-Metro Police Department (LMPD). Redactions were made to the name and address on a piece of mail belonging to an uninvolved party, as well as to a photograph of juveniles found in one of the vehicles, all pursuant to Kentucky Revised Statutes (KRS) 61.878(1)(a).

With regard to the request for body and/or dash camera video, the response indicates that the request will be sent to LMPD Video Records to perform a search for video responsive to the request. Pursuant to KRS 61.872(5) and due to the large volume of pending video requests, the video is currently unavailable. Requestors should allow up to at least six months (by March 20, 2024) to prepare and provide any records they may possess; if records become available earlier, notification will be provided.

The release includes a substantial list of attached image files, primarily JPEG photographs, with filenames such as 530_S_Jackson_St-5.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-9.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-13.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-16.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-18.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-20.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-23.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-24.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-26.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-27.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-29.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-30.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-28.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-34.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-36.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-35.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-37.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-38.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-39.JPG, 530_S_Jackson_St-40.JPG, along with files titled Serious_Injury_Collision.JPG and Serious_Injury_Collision-2.JPG. On April 11, 2024, at 12:33 PM Eastern, the Jefferson Circuit Court (District) accepted a filing in the matter captioned ESTATE OF: YOUNG, EVANGELINE LEE, Case Number 24-P-000354, Envelope Number 7716307. The filing was processed under the NCP for eFiler, in Jefferson Circuit 24-P-000354,Estate of: YOUNG, EVANGELINE LEE, and was submitted by Aaron Gregory Whaley, attorney for the plaintiff. The message was intended for attorney Aaron Whaley and was 26 seconds long, directed to the firm’s main number and to extension 101. The voicemail preview stated: “Hello, my name is Destiny. Please return my call at 888-806-9073 in reference to the estate of a young thank you.” The message was sent to the Whaley firm’s RingCentral inbox and could be listened to via RingCentral or by logging into the account.

In response to the call, Sarena M. Tuttle, a litigation paralegal and workers’ compensation case manager at The Whaley Law Firm, attempted to obtain information but did not receive any. The caller asked for our information; Tuttle advised that the call was not personal to her, that she works for a personal injury attorney, and that the call related to the client. The caller was told that our contact information would be removed.

As a debt collector, Ascension Point Recovery Services has six months to file a claim on the Estate Probate Case; the firm will monitor for any such claims filed.

Sarena M. Tuttle’s contact details are as follows: she is a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222. Her direct line is (502) 357-9971, and her office line is (502) 583-4022, extension 104. Her email is Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, and a note indicates a new email address.

Howard) in the request for records. The case concerns a motor vehicle accident dated August 12, 2023 (the date of service referenced as DOS 08/12/2023), and the Whaley Law Firm represents the estate in pursuing certified medical records and related billing.

On June 12, 2024, Sarena M. Tuttle, a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, sent an email to Fern Creek Fire & EMS, addressed to Jessica Barker, attaching the office’s request for certified medical records and billing for the above-referenced client/patient. The email instructed Fern Creek Fire & EMS to provide any and all billing and records for any and all departments for the dates listed and stated that if there were any questions, they should not hesitate to contact the sender. The signature block identified Sarena M. Tuttle, with her titles and designation, and listed The Whaley Law Firm’s address at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, along with direct dial (502) 357-9971, office line (502) 583-4022 ext 104, and the email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, noting it as the new email address.

The email chain also includes the initial June 12, 2024 message in which Sarena Tuttle wrote, “Good afternoon, Please find attached our office's request for certified medical records and billing on the above referenced client/patient. Please provide any and all billing & records for any and all departments for the dates listed. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us.” This message carried the same signature block with The Whaley Law Firm’s contact details and again included the note indicating the email address is the new one.

On August 19, 2024, a follow-up communication from Sarena M. Tuttle to Jessica Barker was sent: “Good afternoon Jessica, On June 12, 2024, we sent over the attached Request for Certified Medical Records & Billing on the above reference client. To date, we have not received any response from your office. Please forward the Certified Medical Records & Billing for Evangeline Young (Formerly Howard) for DOS 08/12/2023. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us directly to discuss them in further detail.” This follow-up reiterates the request for the same Certified Medical Records & Billing, confirms Evangeline Young’s name update from Evangeline L. Howard, and again provides Sarena’s contact details and the firm’s address, along with the note to “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS.”

Jacob Ray, et al., Jefferson County case number 24-CI-003826. The record includes a sequence of email communications among W. Bryce Koon, Esq., of The Whaley Law Firm, and Katie Watts, a partner at the receiving firm, with several cc’d recipients and filevine/file storage addresses.

On July 10, 2024, Bryce Koon sent an email with the subject Estate of Evangeline Young v. Jacob Ray, et al. (Jefferson 24-CI-003826) to Katie Watts and John Parker, with two additional recipients cc’d: the Evangeline Young MVA 8/12/2023 Filevine project email address EvangelineYoungMVAZ3900418@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com and Scott Gowen. In the body of that message, he stated, “Good afternoon counsel,” and advised that attached to the email was Plaintiff’s First Set of Discovery to Defendant Derby City Gaming, along with the associated notice filed today, offering to answer any questions in that regard. The email closed with his signature, including his name, title, firm, and contact details: W. Bryce Koon, Esq.; The Whaley Law Firm; 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; Phone: (502) 365-5043; Fax: (502) 237-3207. The message also included the standard attorney-client privilege disclaimer indicating the electronic message is intended only for the named recipient and detailing that no waiver of privilege applies if received in error.

Earlier in the thread, in a message from Bryce Koon, he wrote to Ms. Watts: “Good morning Ms. Watts, I should have those responses to you by the end of the week. Can you advise when we may expect your client's responses? Thank you.” This message was signed by Bryce Koon, Esq., with the same firm address and contact information and was followed by the same or similar privilege disclaimer found in his other emails.

On September 3, 2024, Katie Watts replied to Mr. Koon, noting that the client’s overdue responses to written discovery were outstanding and asking, “Mr. Koon, Please advise as to when we can expect to receive your client’s overdue responses to written discovery. Thanks.” This message was time-stamped as being sent at approximately 9:55?AM, and it was signed by Katie Watts, Partner, with a Direct line provided: (502) 560-9949. The email also included the standard privilege disclaimer typical of the correspondence.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate of Evangeline Young arising from an August 12, 2023 motor vehicle accident, Estate of Evangeline Young v. Jacob Ray, et al., Jefferson County Circuit Court, case number 24-CI-003826. The estate is represented by The Whaley Law Firm. The note documents a chain of correspondence regarding discovery in the matter, with the primary sender identified as W. Bryce Koon, Esq., and the recipient as Katie Watts, Esq., both involved in the case, and with several individuals copied on the messages (including Evangeline Young MVA 8/12/2023 Filevine project email address, Scott Gowen of Louisville, KY, and Sarena Tuttle of Whaley Law Firm). The subject line of the primary thread is “Estate of Evangeline Young v. Jacob Ray, et al. (Jefferson 24-CI-003826).”

On July 10, 2024, Bryce Koon sent an email to Katie Watts with the subject noted above, attaching Plaintiff’s First Set of Discovery to Defendant Derby City Gaming and the associated notice filed that day. He indicated that if there were any questions, Katie should let him know. The email included Bryce’s standard signature for The Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with the firm’s phone number (502) 365-5043 and fax (502) 237-3207, and carried the customary attorney‑client privilege disclaimer stating that the message is intended only for the named recipient and that any error should be reported to The Whaley Law Firm. The CC line included Evangeline Young MVA 8/12/2023 Filevine Project Email Address and Scott Gowen (scott.gowen@louisvilleky.gov).

Earlier that day, or in the same thread, no further content from Katie Watts is shown, but the chain continues with subsequent messages in September.

On September 3, 2024, at 9:55 AM, Katie Watts replied to Bryce, requesting that he advise when they could expect his client’s overdue responses to written discovery. She signed as Partner, with direct line (502) 560-9949, and included the customary confidentiality notice.

Shortly thereafter, at 10:20 AM on September 3, 2024, Bryce responded: he anticipated having those responses by the end of the week and again asked Katie to advise when they might expect her client’s responses. He reiterated the request for the other side’s responses and closed with his standard firm signature and confidentiality disclaimer.

On October 14, 2024, at 8:34 AM, Katie Watts wrote again in the same thread: she did not believe they had ever received the discovery responses referenced previously and asked Bryce to advise. Her message again included the attorney’s signature block and the standard confidentiality disclaimer.

Later that same day, at 10:09 AM, Bryce replied to Katie. He explained that he had nearly everything ready but was still awaiting a couple of items from Mr. Young—verification and authorizations, among others. He stated that he had sent everything but had not yet received the signatures, and he committed to following up that day and expected to have the materials shortly. He then requested, in the meantime, that Katie advise when they might expect the opposing side’s responses as well. His message concluded with his signature, the firm’s contact information, and the confidentiality notice.

Overall, the record reflects an ongoing exchange regarding the production of discovery responses in Estate of Evangeline Young, with multiple confirmations that the plaintiff’s discovery was prepared or nearly ready, and ongoing requests for the defendants’ overdue responses, while the estate sought to obtain signatures and verifications from Mr. Young to finalize the materials.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of-Evangeline-Young-MVA-8-12-2023. The client is the Estate of Evangeline Young. This matter is Estate of Evangeline Young v. Jacob Ray, et al., Jefferson County, case number 24-CI-003826.

Between July and October 2024, counsel exchanged a series of discovery-related emails regarding the Derby City Gaming matter in the Jefferson County case. On July 10, 2024 at 5:16 PM, W. Bryce Koon, Esq., of The Whaley Law Firm, sent Katie Watts, Esq., of PPOA Law, with cc to Evangeline Young MVA 8/12/2023 - Filevine Project Email Address (EvangelineYoungMVAZ3900418@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com) and to Scott Gowen, regarding Estate of Evangeline Young v. Jacob Ray, et al. The subject was the Jefferson County case 24-CI-003826. In the body, Koon advised that attached to the email was Plaintiff's First Set of Discovery to Defendant Derby City Gaming, along with the associated notice filed that day, and he invited any questions. He signed the message with his Whaley Law Firm contact information and included the standard attorney‑client privilege disclaimer stating the message is intended only for the named recipient and should not be shared or used if received in error.

On September 3, 2024, at 9:55 AM, Katie Watts replied to Bryce Koon, stating: “Mr. Koon, Please advise as to when we can expect to receive your client’s overdue responses to written discovery. Thanks.” Watts’s message carried her signature block showing she is a Partner and providing Direct: (502) 560-9949, and again included the filevine project email address in the cc list, along with the same attorney‑client privilege disclaimer present in the earlier email.

Later that same day, at 10:20 AM, Bryce Koon responded: “Good morning Ms. Watts, I should have those responses to you by the end of the week. Can you advise when we may expect your client's responses?” His reply, which again included the filevine address in the CC line and carried The Whaley Law Firm signature block with the same contact information and the standard confidentiality disclaimer, reiterated, in effect, his expectation to provide the client’s responses by week’s end and requested guidance on when the opposing side might provide their responses as well.

These September exchanges followed an earlier July 10, 2024 email from Bryce Koon. In that July email, sent at 5:16 PM to Katie Watts and John Parker and cc’ing Evangeline Young MVA 8/12/2023 – Filevine Project Email Address and Scott Gowen, Koon stated, “Good afternoon counsel, Attached hereto you will find Plaintiff's First Set of Discovery to Defendant Derby City Gaming, along with the associated notice filed today. If you have any questions in this regard, please let me know.” The email again bore The Whaley Law Firm signature block and its confidentiality disclaimer, and included the same filevine address as part of the cc list.

Finally, on October 14, 2024, at approximately 8:34 AM, Katie Watts wrote: “Bryce, I do not believe we ever received the discovery responses indicated below. Please advise.” This message also carried Watts’s professional signature and the standard privilege disclaimer.

Shortly thereafter, on October 14, 2024, at 10:09:27 AM, Bryce Koon replied: “Good morning Katie, I have everything just about ready to go, but I am still waiting on a couple of things from Mr. Young (verification, authorizations, etc.). I have sent everything over, but am yet to receive signatures. I will follow up again today, and should have them over to you very shortly. In the meantime, could you please advise when we may expect your client's responses as well?” This final reply again included the Whaley Law Firm contact information and the standard attorney‑client privilege disclaimer.

In sum, the record reflects a continuing negotiation over Plaintiff’s First Set of Discovery and corresponding responses in the Estate of Evangeline Young v. Jacob Ray, et al. The Whaley Law Firm reported near-term delivery of Mr. Young’s verifications and signatures, while requesting reciprocal timing from opposing counsel for their client’s discovery responses. Each email carried the applicable confidentiality disclaimer and the relevant contact details for the sending firm, and several messages referenced the Filevine project email address associated with Evangeline Young MVA.

episodes.natural_language:
In the matter of Dwight Young, et al. v. Jacob Ray, et al. (Jefferson 24-CI-003826), a matter captioned as Estate-of-Evangeline-Young-MVA-8-12-2023 with the client identified as the Estate of Evangeline Young, counsel exchanged discovery-related emails in late October and early November 2024. The October 31, 2024 message was sent from W. Bryce Koon, Esq., of The Whaley Law Firm in Louisville to Scott Gowen, with Evangeline Young MVA 8/12/2023 – Filevine Project Email Address CC’d. In that email, Bryce stated that after reviewing his file it did not appear that the opposing party had provided any responses to their discovery requests and he asked when those responses could be expected. The message included the caution that it originated from outside Louisville Metro and carried standard attorney-client privilege and confidentiality notices.

Scott Gowen replied on November 8, 2024, at approximately 8:50 AM, apologizing for the delay and asking for an extension until the end of the month. Bryce Koon then responded later that same day, November 8, 2024 at 1:22 PM, indicating that the requested extension was acceptable and asking, in the interim, whether Officer Ray’s vehicle is presently located or still available. Bryce’s reply also included his standard contact information for The Whaley Law Firm, and the message continued to carry the customary attorney-client privilege and confidentiality notices.

episodes.natural_language:
In the matter of Estate of Evangeline Young v. Jacob Ray, et al. (Jefferson 24-CI-003826), the plaintiff is the Estate of Evangeline Young, arising from a motor vehicle accident on August 12, 2023. The note here compiles a sequence of email communications among the parties’ counsel regarding discovery, signatures, and scheduling, with cc’d recipients including the Evangeline Young MVA 8/12/2023 Filevine project address, Scott Gowen of Louisville/KY, and Sarena Tuttle.

On July 10, 2024, W. Bryce Koon, Esq., of The Whaley Law Firm, sent an email to Katie Watts and others advising that, attached to the message, Plaintiff’s First Set of Discovery to Defendant Derby City Gaming had been filed that day, along with the associated notice. He stated that if there were any questions, they should be directed to him, and he provided his firm’s contact information.

On September 3, 2024, at 9:55 a.m., Katie Watts asked Mr. Koon to advise when they could expect the defendant’s overdue responses to written discovery. The thread continued with Bryce Koon replying at 10:20 a.m.: “Good morning Ms. Watts, I should have those responses to you by the end of the week. Can you advise when we may expect your client’s responses?” He noted that he had “everything just about ready to go,” but was still waiting on a few items from Mr. Young (verification, authorizations, etc.), and that he had sent everything but had not yet received signatures. He added that he would follow up again that day and should have them over to her very shortly. The message concluded with the standard attorney-client privilege disclaimer.

Earlier in the thread, there were repeated expectations and inquiries about discovery, with Bryce’s message indicating that certain items required Mr. Young’s signatures and authorizations, and that Katie’s team’s responses were being awaited.

On the same date, October 3, 2024, Katie Watts sent a separate message to Bryce indicating, “Bryce, I do not believe we ever received the discovery responses indicated below. Please advise.” This was part of the ongoing exchange regarding discovery responses and the status of production.

Later, on October 14, 2024, Bryce replied to Katie’s ongoing inquiry from the morning: “Good morning Katie, I have everything just about ready to go, but I am still waiting on a couple of things from Mr. Young (verification, authorizations, etc.). I have sent everything over, but am yet to receive signatures. I will follow up again today, and should have them over to you very shortly. In the meantime, could you please advise when we may expect your client’s responses as well?” He noted that he had sent all applicable materials but was awaiting signatures and further verifications.

That afternoon, at 2:15 p.m. (plus time zone stated as +0000), Katie Watts responded: “I’ll have them to you a couple weeks after I receive yours. I’d also like to schedule Dwight Young’s deposition. Please provide some dates in November/December. Thank you.” Watts identified herself as a partner and provided her direct line: (502) 560-9949.

Earlier in the day, Katie had also posted, “Bryce, I do not believe we ever received the discovery responses indicated below. Please advise,” reiterating the need for the other side’s discovery responses.

Throughout these exchanges, standard attorney-client privileged disclosures and instructions were included in each message. The communications were addressed to and cc’d multiple times among the firms involved, including The Whaley Law Firm and the plaintiff’s filevine project address, as well as Scott Gowen and Sarena Tuttle, with the subject line consistently referencing Estate of Evangeline Young v. Jacob Ray, et al. (Jefferson 24-CI-003826).

In summary, the record reflects ongoing discovery efforts in the Estate of Evangeline Young matter, with Plaintiff’s First Set of Discovery to Derby City Gaming filed on July 10, 2024, repeated inquiries about overdue responses from the defense, and concurrent steps to schedule Dwight Young’s deposition, including requests for November/December dates. The parties’ counsel repeatedly noted that certain items (verification, authorizations, and signatures) were outstanding from Mr. Young, and that the plaintiff anticipated receiving the defense’s responses and the plaintiff’s own responses in a staggered timeline.
episodes.author: Sarena Tuttle

episodes.natural_language:
The case is Estate of Evangeline Young v. Jacob Ray, et al., Jefferson County Circuit Court case number 24-CI-003826, with the client listed as the Estate of Evangeline Young. The matter is an MVA (motor vehicle accident) action initiated by the estate, and the structured note documents a series of discovery communications between counsel for the estate, W. Bryce Koon, Esq., of The Whaley Law Firm, and opposing counsel, Katie Watts, Partner (at the time) with the recipient firm identified in the header. The emails also circulated to the Evangeline Young MVA Filevine project address, Scott Gowen of Louisville/County government, and Sarena Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm, among others. The communications span July 10, 2024, through November 18, 2024, and reference the defendant Derby City Gaming.

On July 10, 2024, Bryce Koon sent an email to Katie Watts attaching Plaintiff’s First Set of Discovery to Defendant Derby City Gaming, along with the accompanying notice filed on that date, and he invited any questions about the discovery materials.

In the sequence that followed, on September 3, 2024, Katie Watts asked when the overdue discovery responses might be provided by Mr. Koon’s client, and Bryce Koon replied later that same morning (at 10:20 AM) that he should have those responses by the end of the week and asked Katie to advise when they could expect her client’s responses as well. Earlier that morning, Watts had urged prompting a response to the overdue discovery.

On September 3, 2024, Watts reiterated the request for overdue responses, and Koon responded with the promise of forthcoming responses by week’s end and inquired again about when they might receive the opposing party’s responses.

On October 14, 2024, Katie Watts stated that she did not believe the discovery responses had ever been received as indicated in the prior communications and asked Bryce Koon to advise. In response, Bryce Koon replied later that morning (10:09 AM) that he had nearly everything prepared but was still waiting on a few things from Mr. Young—verification and authorizations—and that although he had sent everything, he had not yet received the signatures. He indicated he would follow up that day and should have the materials shortly, and he again requested Ms. Watts to advise when they might expect her client’s responses.

Also on October 14, 2024, Watts replied (at 10:16 AM) that she would provide Derby City Gaming’s responses a couple of weeks after receiving Mr. Koon’s, and she requested dates in November or December to schedule Dwight Young’s deposition.

Finally, on November 18, 2024, Bryce Koon sent a closing inquiry: “Good afternoon counsel, please advise when we may expect Derby City Gaming’s response to the outstanding discovery requests in this regard.” The message again carried the same formal attorney-disclaimer language about privilege and recipient limitations.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of-Evangeline-Young-MVA-8-12-2023. Client: Estate of Evangeline Young.

In the matter of Estate of Evangeline Young v. Jacob Ray, et al. (Jefferson County Circuit Court, case number 24-CI-003826), counsel at The Whaley Law Firm engaged in a sequence of discovery communications during 2024. On July 10, 2024, W. Bryce Koon, Esq., wrote to Katie Watts, Esq., attaching Plaintiff’s First Set of Discovery to Defendant Derby City Gaming and the associated notice filed that day. He asked that if there were any questions, she let him know, and he signed the message as “W. Bryce Koon, Esq.” The Whaley Law Firm’s contact details appeared in the signature: 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; phone 502-365-5043; fax 502-237-3207. The email also carried the customary attorney-client privilege disclaimer.

Earlier, on September 3, 2024, Katie Watts asked Bryce when they could expect the defendants’ overdue responses to written discovery. Bryce replied later that same day, stating that he should have the responses by the end of the week and asking Katie to advise when the estate could expect its own responses.

Also on September 3, 2024, Bryce reached out again asking when the defense’s responses would be provided, reiterating his request for clarity on the timing of the other side’s disclosures.

On October 14, 2024, Katie Watts responded that she did not believe they had ever received the discovery responses referenced in the prior communications and asked Bryce to advise. Bryce replied that he had almost everything prepared but was still waiting for a couple of items from Mr. Young, specifically verification and authorizations, and that he had sent everything but had not yet received signatures. He said he would follow up again that day and should have the materials shortly, and he asked Katie to indicate when the plaintiff’s responses might be produced.

Later on October 14, 2024, Katie Watts replied that she would deliver the defense’s responses a couple of weeks after she received Bryce’s materials and also requested scheduling Dwight Young’s deposition, asking for dates in November or December.

Finally, on November 18, 2024, at 4:01 PM Eastern Time, Bryce Koon again emailed Katie Watts, asking when Derby City Gaming could be expected to respond to the outstanding discovery requests in this matter. This message was cc’d to Evangeline Young MVA 8/12/2023 – Filevine Project Email Address, Scott Gowen, and Sarena Tuttle.

All communications reflect the ongoing discovery timeline in this case, with the parties each seeking timely responses and scheduling the deposition of Dwight Young, while repeatedly noting that certain signatures, verifications, and authorizations were outstanding. The correspondence displays the typical attorney-client disclaimer included with each Whaley Law Firm email and the continuing coordination among the involved counsel and recipients.

In August 2024, communications between Megan L. Gutgsell, a Subrogation Paralegal in the Law Department of TeamCare, and Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm establish the current status and points of contact for the file. On August 19, 2024 at 11:36 AM, Sarena informed Megan that Mrs. Evangeline Young (formerly Evangeline Howard) has a claim that is in litigation, and that there are no settlement negotiations expected for at least 90 days. She requested Megan to “diary out at least 90 days for a new status update” and asked Megan to update the file to reflect Sarena and Bryce Koon as the new points of contact. Sarena signed as Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager for The Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; her direct line was 502-357-9971, office line 502-583-4022 ext 104, and her email address was Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with a note indicating a NEW EMAIL ADDRESS. The message included the external email warning banner typical for recipients outside the sender’s organization.

Later on August 19, 2024 at 4:04 PM, Megan responded with a request for the contact information for Mr. Bryce Koon so she could update the file and indicated she would set a 90-day calendar reminder.

The following day, August 20, 2024, at 8:56 AM, Sarena replied with Bryce Koon’s contact information: W. Bryce Koon, Esq, The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222. Office phone: 502-583-4022, ext 114; Email: Bryce@WhaleyLawFirm.com. Sarena’s signature line again provided her contact details and included the note to “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS.” This message also carried the HIGH ALERT external email warning.

On November 19, 2024 at 5:39 PM UTC, Megan Gutgsell (Leg) sent a follow-up email to Sarena Tuttle requesting an update on the status of the case. The message began with “Good Morning Sarena, Can you please provide an update on the status of the case?” and was signed with Megan’s contact information: mgutgsel@centralstatesfunds.org, TeamCare – A Central States Health Fund, 8647 W. Higgins Road, Chicago, IL 60631; Office: (847) 939-2441; Fax: (847) 518-9797. The email included the subject line “RE: Howard, Evangeline L. TM 23-23403 Case status send unencrypted.”

The communications repeatedly reference the case as relating to Evangeline Young, who is identified as having the claim in litigation, with no settlement negotiations anticipated for at least 90 days, and the expectation to update the status at 90-day intervals. The messages include the standard attorney-client confidentiality disclosures and disclaimers, noted at the end of the transmissions, including twice-stated disclaimers that the benefits interpretations are not final determinations and that the information is privileged where applicable.

In summary, the file for the Estate of Evangeline Young in the TM 23-23403 matter has been managed with new points of contact at The Whaley Law Firm (Sarena M. Tuttle and Bryce Koon) and the subrogation team at TeamCare has been coordinating status updates, with a current stance that the claim remains in litigation and that no settlement negotiations are expected for at least 90 days, with calendar reminders to monitor the status accordingly.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Estate-of Evangeline Young v. Jacob Ray, et al. (Jefferson 24-CI-003826). Client: Estate of Evangeline Young.

The matter centers on the Estate of Evangeline Young and its liabilities against Jacob Ray and others in Jefferson County Circuit Court, case number 24-CI-003826. The communications documented here trace discovery and deposition scheduling efforts between counsel for the Estate and the defendant Derby City Gaming, beginning in July 2024 and continuing through November 2024.

On July 10, 2024, W. Bryce Koon, Esq., of The Whaley Law Firm, informed Katie Watts that Plaintiff’s First Set of Discovery to Defendant Derby City Gaming had been attached, along with the associated notice filed that day. He stated that if there were any questions, she should let him know, and he provided his firm’s contact details. This message circulated with the subject of the Estate of Evangeline Young v. Jacob Ray, et al. (Jefferson 24-CI-003826) and included copies to the relevant Filevine project address and colleagues, with standard attorney-client notice disclaimers.

On September 3, 2024, Katie Watts responded, asking to be advised when they could expect the defendant’s responses to the written discovery. In a follow-up that day, Bryce Koon replied that he should have those responses by the end of the week and asked Katie to advise when their client’s responses could be expected as well.

Later that same day, Katie again pressed for clarification on the overdue responses, stating that she did not believe they had received the discovery responses indicated. Bryce had earlier indicated he would have the responses by week’s end and reiterated his request for Katie’s client’s responses.

Moving to October 2024, on October 14 at 8:34 a.m., Katie Watts wrote that she did not believe they had ever received the discovery responses referenced previously and asked Bryce to advise. At 10:09 a.m., Bryce replied that he had nearly everything ready but was waiting on a couple of items from Mr. Young (verification, authorizations, etc.), and that he had sent everything over but had not yet received signatures. He indicated he would follow up that day and should have them over shortly, and he requested that Katie advise when they could expect her client’s responses.

Later on October 14, at 10:16 a.m., Katie replied that she would send them “a couple weeks after I receive yours” and that she would also like to schedule Dwight Young’s deposition, requesting dates in November and December.

Throughout this period, notices and emails continued to circulate among counsel, with confidentiality notices typical of electronic communications indicating that the messages were intended only for the named recipients and advising that any inadvertent receipt should be reported to The Whaley Law Firm and that the information should not be used or shared.

On November 18, 2024, Bryce again asked for guidance on when Derby City Gaming’s outstanding discovery responses could be expected, reiterating the request in the ongoing discovery process.

Finally, on November 22, 2024, Katie Watts replied that the discovery materials were nearly complete and, due to the upcoming holiday, she expected to have them to Bryce two weeks from that date, if not sooner. She signed as a partner, providing direct contact information.

Notes: The email chain includes the following participants and references: Katie Watts (recipient/counsel), Bryce Koon (counsel), the Estate of Evangeline Young MVA 8/12/2023 Filevine project address (CC’d), Scott Gowen (CC’d), and Sarena Tuttle (CC’d). The communications reference Derby City Gaming as the defendant and discuss the Plaintiff’s First Set of Discovery, outstanding discovery responses, verification and authorizations from Mr. Young, and the scheduling of Dwight Young’s deposition. The correspondence includes standard attorney-client privileged notices and confidentiality language typical of the electronic messages exchanged.

episodes.original_body:
Case: Estate-of-Evangeline-Young-MVA-8-12-2023
Client: Estate of Evangeline Young

__CLIENT CONTACT__
__Details:__ Def DCG attempting to state Client was not at their establishment that evening - Per BK sent Request to S/O for any evidence he has that she was in fact at DCG that night

Good afternoon Dwight,
Bryce asked me to reach to you & request a copy of a bank/credit card statement for the night of Evangeline's incident. The Defendant Derby City Gaming is attempting to claim that Evangeline was not in their establishment that evening. This is a typical defense present by many businesses in an attempt to not be held libel for over serving patrons. Please forward any evidence in your possession that Evangeline was in fact at Derby City Gaming on August 11-12, 2023. This can include text screenshots, pictures, receipts, bank/credit statements, etc. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us directly to discuss them in further detail. -Sarena, The Whaley Law Firm 
__Person Making Contact:__ Sarena
__Date & Time__: January 23 2025
episodes.natural_language:
Initial client contact on January 23, 2025, with Sarena of The Whaley Law Firm regarding the Estate of Evangeline Young MVA (8-12-2023). The client note indicates that the Defendant, Derby City Gaming (DCG), is attempting to claim that Evangeline was not at their establishment that evening. Per BK, a request has been sent to S/O for any evidence that she was in fact at DCG that night.

In a follow-up outreach, an email was directed to Dwight beginning with “Good afternoon Dwight,” stating that Bryce asked to obtain a copy of a bank/credit card statement for the night of Evangeline’s incident. The message explains that DCG is attempting to claim Evangeline was not at the establishment that evening and notes that this is a common defense used by many businesses to avoid liability for over-serving patrons. It requests any evidence in Dwight’s possession showing Evangeline’s presence at Derby City Gaming on August 11-12, 2023, including text screenshots, pictures, receipts, bank/credit statements, etc. The note invites any questions and is signed by Sarena of The Whaley Law Firm. The record lists Sarena as the Person Making Contact, dated January 23, 2025.

__Details:__ DC DCG looking to take Dwight Deposition - Looking at 04.22-04.24 - Sent to Client to choose

Good afternoon Dwight,
We hope things have been going well for you and wanted to update you. The Defense Counsel for Derby City Gaming has a few questions for you & would like to formally take your deposition. The Defense has provided the following dates for you to choose from. April 22nd, 23rd or 24th. Your deposition will be scheduled to begin a 1:00pm. Initial client contact on March 6, 2025, with the Estate of Evangeline Young regarding scheduling Dwight’s deposition in the Derby City Gaming matter arising from the Estate-of-Evangeline-Young MVA case dated August 12, 2023. The notes indicate that the defense counsel for Derby City Gaming intends to depose Dwight and is considering dates of April 22 through April 24, 2025, with the deposition to begin at 1:00 p.m., and that this information was sent to the client to choose a date.

The message, sent by Sarena of The Whaley Law Firm, to Dwight reads: "Good afternoon Dwight, We hope things have been going well for you and wanted to update you. The Defense Counsel for Derby City Gaming has a few questions for you & would like to formally take your deposition. The Defense has provided the following dates for you to choose from. April 22nd, 23rd or 24th. Your deposition will be scheduled to begin a 1:00pm. Please let me know as soon as possible which of these dates works best for you. -Sarena, The Whaley Law Firm"

episodes.natural_language:
In the estate matter Estate of Evangeline Young, arising from a motor vehicle accident on August 12, 2023, the case Young v Derby City Gaming LLC, et al. proceeded to deposition scheduling discussions in early 2025. The participants included Katie Watts, a partner at PPOA Law, whose direct line is (502) 560-9949 and whose email is kwatts@ppoalaw.com; Sarena Tuttle, a litigation paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, whose contact details in the thread were D: (502) 357-9971, O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104, E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com (with a note to “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS”); Scott Gowen of FMD Legal (sgowen@fmdlegal.com); Debbie Allen (dallen@ppoalaw.com); Bryce Koon (bryce@whaleylawfirm.com); and Aaron Whaley (agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com). The exchange began with a March–April 2025 deposition scheduling conversation and culminated in a firm notice for a deposition on May 30, 2025 at 1:30 p.m. at Katie Watts’s office.

The first substantive message in this thread is from March 6, 2025 at 11:05 a.m., when Sarena Tuttle emailed Katie Watts (and copied Scott Gowen, Debbie Allen, Bryce Koon, and Aaron Whaley) to acknowledge the delay and to coordinate dates for a 1:30 p.m. start at least three weeks out, noting that Mr. Young is a 3rd shift worker and that they would update as soon as possible after sending dates to Mr. Young. In that same exchange, Scott Gowen replied at 1:53 p.m. indicating that he could do April 22–24, and he asked to be addressed with the correct spelling of his name as Gowen (not Gowan).

Katie Watts replied at 11:46 a.m. on March 6 with availability for April 8, 9, 15, 17, and 18, asking Mr. Gowen to confirm his availability as well. Scott Gowen responded again at 11:55 a.m. stating that of those dates he could only do April 18, and he again reminded about the correct spelling Gowen. Sarena Tuttle then followed at 12:07 p.m. with a note of thanks and a commitment to send the proposed dates to Mr. Young and provide updates as soon as possible.

By March 31, 2025 at 2:00 p.m., Katie Watts asked Sarena for any update. On April 1, 2025, at 10:44 a.m., Sarena replied apologetically and stated that Mr. Young would be available April 22, 2025, at 1:30 p.m. and that they were open to using Katie Watts’s office if that arrangement was acceptable to Mr. Gowen and to Katie. In a following message the same day at 10:48 a.m., Sarena added that they were available for deposition on May 30 or June 18, indicating two alternative dates for scheduling.

Finally, on April 2, 2025 at 8:14 p.m. UTC, Katie Watts informed Sarena and the others that they would notice for May 30 at 1:30 p.m. at Katie Watts’s office. Katie’s note concluded with her signature, identifying her as a Partner and providing her direct line again.

Thus, after a back-and-forth regarding preferred start times and dates that accommodated Mr. Young’s 3rd-shift schedule and the parties’ motions practice considerations (noting that motions can be filed as late as the Wednesday before a deposition and that Mondays in Jefferson County and Fridays in Fayette County are generally avoided), the deposition for Young v Derby City Gaming LLC, et al. was scheduled to be noticed for May 30, 2025 at 1:30 p.m., to be held at Katie Watts’s office.
episodes.author: Sarena Tuttle
